# Draft:Cortico (software)

Cortico is a Canadian health-technology company that develops patient-engagement and workflow-automation software for medical practices.
The company’s software integrates with electronic medical record (EMR) systems and is used by clinics to manage appointment booking, secure messaging, intake forms, automated reminders, and payment processing.
History
Cortico was founded in 2015 following a pilot project at Kensington Medical Clinic in Burnaby, British Columbia.
The pilot, led by physician Greg Baldwin and software developer Clark Van Oyen, introduced online appointment booking and automated workflows aimed at reducing administrative workload in the clinic.
The system was later incorporated as Cortico Health Technologies Inc. and made available to other medical practices.
In 2024, Cortico partnered with Intrahealth Systems to integrate its platform with the Profile EMR, expanding its interoperability across multiple electronic record systems.
Products and features
Cortico’s software is described as a patient-engagement and automation platform.
It offers online scheduling, secure two-way messaging, digital intake forms, and automated reminders for appointments.
The platform also includes modules for payment processing and AI-supported document management, developed in partnership with Waive the Wait.
Cortico integrates with Canadian EMRs such as OSCAR, Accuro, Juno, and Intrahealth Profile.
Operations
As of 2025, the company reports that its software is used in over 400 clinics across Canada, the United States, and the Caribbean.
Cortico Health Technologies is based in Richmond, British Columbia, and has been recognized by New Ventures BC as one of the province’s emerging technology firms.
